page.title: 10Nore Hill Folly _Slindon.
page.content: Nore Hill Folly was built in the Nineteenth century by Lady Newburgh, the Lady of the Manor from Slindon House. It is a strange building almost on the top of Nore Hill, looking a bit like part of a ruined castle from the distance. On closer inspection this can be seen to be a false impression. It is sited on the side of a wooded hill with beautiful views in three directions. Lady Newburgh used this folly as a picnic place. You can imagine the butler and staff being sent off up the hill with picnic baskets,tables and chairs and setting it out so that Lady N.and her guests could enjoy a leisurly stroll or horse ride up the hill to enjoy an alfresco lunch! Nowadays the Folly is owned and maintained by the National Trust,but no one uses it for picnics any more.
